ai.summary: Long Walk is a 14.5 km moderately challenging hike in the UK. The route offers a steady pace, varying terrain, and scenic views, suitable for hikers with a comfortable fitness level and a willingness to navigate mixed paths and occasional gradients.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail features a mix of grassy paths, gentle grassy slopes, woodland edges, and some gravel or compacted soil sections. Expect occasional mud after rain and short ascents or descents; footing is generally good but can be uneven in places.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Bring a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Inform someone of your planned route and expected return time. Be prepared for mud, uneven ground, and variable UK weather; carry rain protection and sun protection as appropriate. Stay on official paths and watch for road crossings and livestock if near farmland.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder, drier conditions, but the hike can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear and caution for shorter daylight hours in winter.

seo.title: Long Walk | 14.5 km Moderate Hike in the UK
